#Text=ON THE SAND BAR
#Text=Owen Ford left Four Winds the next morning .
#Text=In the evening Anne went over to see Leslie , but found nobody .
#Text=The house was locked and there was no light in any window .
#Text=It looked like a home left soulless .
#Text=Leslie did not run over on the following day -- which Anne thought a bad sign .
#Text=Gilbert having occasion to go in the evening to the fishing cove , Anne drove with him to the Point , intending to stay awhile with Captain Jim .
#Text=But the great light , cutting its swathes through the fog of the autumn evening , was in care of Alec Boyd and Captain Jim was away .
#Text=" What will you do ? " asked Gilbert .
#Text=" Come with me ? "
#Text=" I do n't want to go to the cove -- but I 'll go over the channel with you , and roam about on the sand shore till you come back .

#Text= Leslie ! " exclaimed Anne in amazement .

column1: #Text=" Whatever are you doing -- HERE -- tonight ? "
#Text=" If it comes to that , whatever are YOU doing here ? " said Leslie , trying to laugh .
#Text=The effort was a failure .
#Text=She looked very pale and tired ; but the love locks under her scarlet cap were curling about her face and eyes like little sparkling rings of gold .
#Text=" I 'm waiting for Gilbert -- he 's over at the Cove .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= Well , I came here because I wanted to walk -- and walk -- and WALK , " said Leslie restlessly .

column1: #Text=" I could n't on the rock shore -- the tide was too high and the rocks prisoned me .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= Leslie , dearest , what is the trouble ? " asked Anne , though she knew too well already .

column1: #Text=" I ca n't tell you --

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=She laughed bitterly .

#Text= Leslie , is it that you have learned to care for Mr. Ford ? "

column1: #Text=Leslie turned herself about passionately .
#Text=" How did you know ? " she cried .
#Text=" Anne , how did you know ?

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= Do you despise me ? " demanded Leslie in a fierce , low tone .

column1: #Text=" Do you think I 'm wicked -- unwomanly ?

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= I do n't think you any of those things .

_	_	_	_

#Text= But -- oh , it 's so -- so shameful , " murmured Leslie .

column1: #Text=" To love him -- unsought -- and when I 'm not free to love anybody . "
#Text=" There 's nothing shameful about it .

column3:

#Text=But I 'm very sorry that you have learned to care for Owen , because , as things are , it will only make you more unhappy .

#Text= I did n't LEARN to care , " said Leslie , walking on and speaking passionately .
